summary: This document is an email forwarding a draft letter to congressional leaders regarding Jeffrey Epstein. It shows internal DOJ coordination on a congressional communication about the Epstein case shortly after his death, indicating high-level attention and a need for rapid review.

persons.name: Principal Associate Deputy Attorney General
persons.context: The sender of the forwarded email, requesting a rapid review of a draft letter to Congress regarding Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Drafting of Congressional Letter on Epstein
events.description: The Principal Associate Deputy Attorney General circulates a draft letter intended for congressional leaders regarding Jeffrey Epstein, requesting urgent review.

keyFacts: The U.S. Department of Justice was preparing a formal communication to congressional leaders about Jeffrey Epstein in August 2019.
The communication was being drafted and reviewed at a high level within the DOJ, involving the Principal Associate Deputy Attorney General.
The timing (August 12, 2019) indicates this was likely in response to Epstein's death on August 10, 2019, and the ensuing political and public scrutiny.
The email indicates a tight turnaround and urgency in finalizing the congressional letter.
An attachment named 'Epstein_ltr.pdf' suggests the draft letter was a separate, substantive document.
